name: SetGithubIssueLabels
description:
Set new labels for a GitHub issue.

Use this tool to remove all existing labels and apply new labels to a specified issue in a GitHub repository. Ideal for organizing and categorizing issues effectively.

parameters.name: repository_owner
parameters.description: The GitHub username or organization name of the repository owner. Not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: repository_name
parameters.description: The name of the repository. This is not case sensitive and identifies the repository within which the issue resides.

value_schema.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: issue_number
parameters.description: The unique identifier number for the GitHub issue to update labels.

value_schema.description: The number that identifies the issue.

parameters.name: new_labels
parameters.description: A list of new labels to set for the GitHub issue, formatted as JSON array of strings.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the GitHub API.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: repo
parameters.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: issue_number
parameters.description: The number that identifies the issue.

value_schema.description: The number that identifies the issue.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
